Directions: intro, write, practice, spell, mastery, fluency, test and pronounce.
Pronounce indicates an Intro lesson with a pronounce image in the sidebar.
The tab name is the tab name as it is displayed in the lessons nav bar.
It also corresponds to the LessonName field in unifiedLessons.json
Individual lesson notes have been moved to the notes field in unifiedLessons.json.
In the desired lesson use the following format: (replace single quotes with double)

default_tab_notes.write:
Instructions: Read the list of words with the student. Then stop sharing the screen, refresh the list, and give the student 5 or 6 words to write.

Have the student tell you the phonemes in the word before writing it. (For example, the student would say c - a - t before writing cat.)
default_tab_notes.practice: Instructions: Have the student practice reading the words. Challenge the student with the stopwatch to make it more interesting. Refresh the list for additional practice.
default_tab_notes.spell:
Instructions: Give the student control of the mouse and dictate words from the lesson.

Note: It works best to change one sound at a time. ie: mat -> cat -> cap -> sap -> sat -> sit
default_tab_notes.test:
Instructions: Shoot for a goal of 15 seconds. (Be flexible for students with slow processing speed. Automaticity is more important than speed.)

Click Mastered if the student does not need to review the lesson again. Click Advancing if the student can move on but needs to revisit the lesson at a later date.
default_tab_notes.fluency:
Instructions: Time the student reading the passage 3 times.

Define unfamiliar words.

Encourage fluency and accuracy over speed.
default_tab_notes.mastery: Instructions: Check off the word if the student reads it correctly. Review incorrect words when you get to the end of the list.
default_tab_notes.intro: Read across or down. Require clear pronunciation.

G99.spell: Tell me what to say here.
